description.p: DoD Fellowship.

Derek interviewed with several teams and had a lengthly screening process (through no fault of his own). Ultimately, Josh List and Kyle Rohan decided they wanted to bring him on as a fellow for their Vulnerability Management practice, to help establish a threat intel team.

Nov 28-Dec 2: Onboarding starts, Kevin schedules Initial chat with Josh/Dan/Kyle
Dec 5: Begin working with Josh & team
Late December/January: Moves to East Coast
mid-May: Interviews for full-time position; negotiations, hiring process
We can set him up with any of the following:

ul.li: Cyber Threat Resources - "Keeping up with the InfoSec Jones" live GPS class
Connections with Lauren Brennan (Federal Intel) & Tony Cook / GRIT

description.p: Looking out further / full-time:
GPSU can complete the following:

ul.li: Approve/act as direct supervisor for OpenAir timesheets

description.p: DoD Fellowship. Approved on August 5th by USAF.

ul.li: Internship Timeline: Available Mid Sept 2022 - Late Jan; eligible for full-time hire come Feb/Mar 2023
Interests: Strong interests in GRC, very active in certification training

description.p:
From Steve:
I am fine with being John's advisor and appreciate your help coordinating the logistics to onboard John as part of that program. I will have to, using the templates you provided, put together a schedule and endeavor to cover all the portions of our current program so John is exposed to all aspects of GRC currently included in our scope of effort (link).
Given the diversity of services we offer in the IA-GR and IA-C practices, it might also be worthwhile to petition Brian and Dan for an overview of the consultative services they provide.

description.p: Steve Yelverton is a referral that was sent to Kevin Woods (previous CPB unit), coming out of the Army’s Cyber Protection Brigade at Fort Gordon, GA. He has experience using Splunk, and was screened by the GPSU team. Holds an active TS-SCI w/CI Poly and open to relocation – currently in Augusta, GA but will discuss moving to NoVA. … recently told us he no longer is open to relocation.

p.b: Being considered for remote Federal positions on Pfizer project - DLP/IR.

description.p: Daniel is a graduating senior from UCF, where he serves as the president of a hacking organization. Originally referred by Jonathan Singer, Daniel was offered a 12-week internship to get certified up through Splunk Architect, at which point he will be considered for a Security Engineer position on the Federal Data Analytics team.
Accepted internship offer on April 1.

description.p: Shane Edwards is our first in-person DoD fellowship. He comes from the Air Force and will be shadowing with Craig Sandberg in St. Louis.

Prior Military Intelligence - we are getting him started with security fundamentals and SEC+ certification. After which he will start the in-person shadowing. We will then prep him to be a SOC Analyst and (given time) prep him to take the CySA+ examination.

description.p: Krislyn is a transitioning Army service member currently stationed at Fort Gordon, GA and is joining us as part of the Southeast Hiring Our Heroes Cohort 2022-2 in May.
Krislyn conducted initial screening with Taylor/Kevin and then interviewed with Jeanice Russell, who she will be shadowing during the internship.
First two weeks will be spent on onboarding/AWS certification, before moving to shadowing/project work with Jeanice.

description.p: Nathan Davis is a separating Army veteran with 8+ years experience in data analytics and security. Previously worked with Kevin Woods in the 101st ABN and at the Army’s Cyber Protection Brigade (CPB). Has an interest in security engineering and project/program management - likes to be customer facing and work at the strategic level.
Began Beacon training on XSOAR in preparation to starting internship.

description.p: Dexter Tanigue is a retiring Air Force service member, interested in doing Pentesting for his internship to complete his college degree, but looking long-term to do security consulting / defensive operations. Located in Springfield with a TS/SCI.
Originally sourced from Mike Wrona; screened by Kevin/Taylor, and then by Yuri. Came as a referral.

Ian is an Army Solider coming out of the Army’s Cyber Protection Brigade at Fort Gordon GA. Originally sourced/screened by GPSU and then interviewed with Chris Peltz for an internship. Shorter internship due to out-processing timeline.

Originally screened by Kevin/Taylor of GPSU, then interviewed with Jeremy Rupp, prior to receiving DoD SkillBridge internship offer.

description.p:
Full Time Employee - Starts Jan 10th
Jan 3-5: Splunk Cluster Administration
Jan 10-14: Onboarding, Splunk Shadowing (with Billy - Pfizer)
Jan 17-21: Splunk Shadowing (with Gunnar - HC on ESS)
Jan 24-25: Architecting Splunk Enterprise Deployments
Jan 24-28: Splunk Shadowing (with Hawk - HRSA)
& Splunk Lab Practical Prep
Feb 1: Splunk Deployment Practical Lab
Feb 2-10: Splunk Architect Exam Prep & Shadowing
Feb 11: Splunk Certified Architect Exam
Feb 14-18: CKO

Internship - Started on Nov 8th, Finished Dec 23rd
Nov 8-19: Common Core: Operating Systems, Consulting Fund., Effective Communications
Nov 22-24: Splunk Enterprise System Administration
Dec 1-3: Splunk Enterprise Data Administration
Dec 6-8: Splunk Admin Labs & Exam Prep
Dec 9: Certified Splunk Administrator Exam
Dec 10-20: SANS Immersive Academy & Splunk Shadowing
Dec 20-21: Troubleshooting Splunk Enterprise

Self Study - Completed prior to Nov 5th
Splunk User Experience
Fundamentals 1 classes ( & Certified Core User)
Fundamentals 2 classes ( & Certified Power User)
